abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Uganda Second Economic
            and Financial Management Project were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) there can be challenges to changing the
            institutional mind set; 2) the programming approach ensures
            donor coordination and attracting of co-funding; 3)
            challenges and difficulties associated with institutional
            change are frequently not sufficiently appreciated nor
            enough time allocated to successfully implement these
            changes; and 4) flexibility in project implementation is essential.
